title: Region bounded by horizontal line and rational func. part - c

content.description: Let R be the region in the first and second quadrants bounded above by the graph ofÂ <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and below by the horizontal line y = 2.
content.question: The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are semicircles. Find the volume of this solid.

frqParts.text: The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are semicircles. Find the volume of this solid.
